Page.Title: Replace vs Addon Vehicles
Page.Description:
When installing vehicles in LSPDFR, you generally have two options:
- **Replace Vehicles** overwrite an existing in-game vehicle (e.g. police3) by placing files into the latest patchday folder. - **Addon Vehicles** create entirely new vehicle slots by adding a new DLC entry in your game files.
🚨 **Note:** These categories are not always strict. Sometimes, vehicle packs may be designed to replace but are installed like addons, and vice versa.

Fields.Field: If your vehicle pack comes with `.yft` and `.ytd` files, it’s likely a **replace** pack. If it comes with a full folder and instructions about `dlclist.xml`, it's likely an **addon**.

Page.Title: Installing a Replace Vehicle
Page.Description: 1. Rename your vehicle files if needed (e.g., `police3.yft`, `police3.ytd`, etc). 2. Select all relevant `.yft` and `.ytd` files (including those with `_hi`). 3. Drag & drop them into your latest **patchday** using OpenIV. You can find this path using the `/support Replace` command. 4. If you need to modify any text-based files like `vehicles.meta`, you should replace the entries for the vehicles you are modifying rather than overwriting the entire file.

Page.Title: Installing an Addon Vehicle
Page.Description:
1. In OpenIV, go to: `GTAV/mods/update/x64/dlcpacks` 2. Drag and drop the entire **vehicle folder** (e.g., `carpack`) into that directory. 3. Navigate to: `GTAV/mods/update/update.rpf/common/data/dlclist.xml` 4. Add the following line at the bottom of the list:
<Item>dlcpacks:/carpack/</Item>
🔁 Replace `DLC folder` with the actual name of the vehicle's folder you added in step 2.

Page.Title: Make sure to install the ELS file for ELS vehicles!
Page.Description:
Ensure you install the `.xml` files that come with ELS-enabled vehicle packs. They must go into the following folder: `GTAV/ELS/pack_default`
Without these XML files, emergency lighting may not work correctly.

Page.Title: Unable to drag & drop / edit files into OpenIV
Page.Description:
Having issues dragging or editing files into OpenIV? Try these steps:
1. Make sure **Edit Mode** is enabled (top right corner). 2. Extract the ZIP or RAR download before attempting to install. 3. For `.meta`, `.xml`, or text-based files, **right click > Edit** instead of just double clicking to open them.
